abstract.text: A Boolean value indicating that the app generally supports indirect input mechanisms.

In iOS 17 and later, the system defaults to supporting indirect input events, meaning it treats your app the same as if you specify
In versions of iOS earlier than iOS 17, the system defaults to not supporting indirect input events, meaning it treats your app the same as if you specify

is a compatibility affordance to ease the adoption of indirect input for a UIKit application. Avoid relying on this property and prepare your app to support indirect gestures on all platforms. For visionOS, the system always supports indirect input events and doesn’t consult this key.

abstract.text: Resources located in an app, framework, or plugin bundle.
A resource containing key-value pairs that identify and configure a bundle.
A Boolean value indicating that the app generally supports indirect input mechanisms.
The event relates to scrolling from an indirect input device.
The event relates to a pointer from an indirect input device performing a transformation on a user interface element, such as scaling, rotation, or translation.
The base class for concrete gesture recognizers.
Returns the location of one of the gesture’s touches in the local coordinate system of a given view.
The number of touches involved in the gesture represented by the gesture recognizer.
Asks the delegate if a gesture recognizer should receive an object representing a touch or press event.
A continuous gesture recognizer that interprets pinching gestures involving two touches.
A continuous gesture recognizer that interprets rotation gestures involving two touches.
An object representing the location, size, movement, and force of a touch occurring on the screen.
A touch resulting from direct contact with the screen.
A touch resulting from a button-based, indirect input device that describes the input sequence from button press to button release.
